regions.name: Everest
regions.short_label: Gokyo Valley, Turquoise Lakes, Everest Views

treks.title: Gokyo Lakes Trek
treks.short_description: Trek to the pristine Gokyo Lakes valley with turquoise glacial lakes and Gokyo Ri viewpoint. Less crowded alternative to classic EBC trek with stunning panoramic views of Everest, Lhotse, Cho Oyu, and Makalu from 5,357m.
treks.review_text: Hidden gem of Everest region - pristine turquoise lakes and peaceful mountain valleys without the crowds of standard EBC trek.

hero_section.title: Gokyo Lakes Trek
hero_section.subtitle: Turquoise Alpine Lakes - Gateway to Hidden Everest Vistas

sections.heading: Gokyo Lakes Trek Overview
articles: The Gokyo Lakes Trek is a stunning yet less-crowded alternative to the classic Everest Base Camp trek. Over 11 days, you'll trek through the pristine Gokyo Valley to a chain of five spectacular turquoise glacial lakes nested at 4,790m. The highlight is the ascent to Gokyo Ri (5,357m), which offers 360-degree panoramic views of four 8,000m peaks: Everest, Lhotse, Cho Oyu, and Makalu. The trek features Nepal's largest glacier (Ngozumpa Glacier), authentic Sherpa villages with virtually no tourism infrastructure, and a sense of wilderness and discovery missing from the main EBC route.

bullets.text: Max altitude: 5,357m (Gokyo Ri viewpoint), peaceful glacial lake setting
Five turquoise glacial lakes and Ngozumpa Glacier - Nepal's largest
Moderate-Difficult trek - less crowded than EBC, fewer services

itinerary_days.title: Arrival in Kathmandu & Briefing
itinerary_days.description: Arrive at Tribhuwan International Airport. EverTrek Nepal representative welcomes you. Afternoon trek briefing with focus on Gokyo Valley unique challenges and opportunities.

itinerary_days.title: Fly to Lukla & Trek to Phakding
itinerary_days.description: Scenic 40-minute mountain flight from Ramechap to Lukla (2,800m). Trek downhill through rhododendron forests crossing suspension bridges to Phakding (2,600m).

itinerary_days.title: Trek Phakding to Namche Bazaar
itinerary_days.description: Steep ascent with multiple suspension bridges (Hillary Bridge) over Dudh Koshi River. Arrive at Namche Bazaar (3,440m), the Sherpa capital.

itinerary_days.title: Namche Bazaar - Acclimatization & Exploration
itinerary_days.description: Acclimatization day. Hike to Everest View Hotel (3,880m) for first Everest views. Explore Namche market, Tenzing Norgay Museum, shops, and local culture.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Namche to Dole via Gokyo Valley
itinerary_days.description: Trek northeast through forests away from main EBC route. Reach Dole (4,200m), the gateway to Gokyo Valley. Fewer tourists, more peaceful mountain experience begins here.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Dole to Machhermo
itinerary_days.description: Continue through Gokyo Valley approaching high altitude. Pass through alpine meadows and reach Machhermo (4,470m). Views of Cho Oyu (6,189m) and Ngozumpa Glacier begin.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Machhermo to Gokyo - Turquoise Lakes
itinerary_days.description: Trek to spectacular Gokyo (4,790m) with its chain of five turquoise glacial lakes. This is a magical place - pristine alpine environment with virtually no tourism infrastructure. Explore the lakes and village.

itinerary_days.title: Gokyo - Acclimatization & Gokyo Ri Summit
itinerary_days.description: Acclimatization day at high altitude. Hike to Gokyo Ri (5,357m) for 360-degree panoramic views. See Everest, Lhotse, Cho Oyu, Makalu, Kanguru, and turquoise lakes spread below. One of Nepal's greatest viewpoints.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Gokyo to Machhermo & Return Route
itinerary_days.description: Descend from Gokyo retracing steps to Machhermo. Alternative route back offers different perspectives of glaciers and valleys.

itinerary_days.title: Trek Machhermo to Namche Bazaar
itinerary_days.description: Descend through forests back to Namche Bazaar (3,440m). Return to lower altitude for recovery. Relax and prepare for departure.

itinerary_days.title: Fly Lukla to Kathmandu & Celebration
itinerary_days.description: Trek down to Lukla (3-4 hours). Afternoon scenic return flight to Kathmandu. Evening celebration dinner with EverTrek Nepal team marking trek completion.

highlights.title: Five Turquoise Glacial Lakes - Alpine Treasures
highlights.description:
Explore the spectacular chain of five pristine turquoise glacial lakes in Gokyo Valley. Each lake is a different shade of blue-green depending on light and glacier mineral content.
The fifth lake is the highest and most remote - a rare alpine experience in the Himalayas.
Photographic paradise for mountain lovers.

highlights.title: Gokyo Ri - 360-Degree Mountain Theater
highlights.description:
Hike to Gokyo Ri (5,357m) for 360-degree panoramic views of four 8,000m peaks:
- Mount Everest (8,848m)
- Mount Lhotse (8,516m)
- Mount Cho Oyu (6,189m)
- Mount Makalu (8,485m)
Gokyo Ri rivals Kala Patthar for pure mountain spectacle - and it's far less crowded.

highlights.title: Ngozumpa Glacier - Nepal's Largest Glacier
highlights.description:
Trek across and around Nepal's largest glacier system. Witness the massive expanse of ice, glacial moraines, and dramatic landscape carved by ancient ice flows.
Experience the power of glaciation and climate in real time.
Understand high-altitude alpine ecosystems.

highlights.title: Off-the-Beaten-Path Sherpa Culture
highlights.description:
Experience authentic Sherpa communities largely untouched by mass tourism. Gokyo village operates at subsistence level with traditional yak herding and limited lodges.
Stay in family-run teahouses with genuine Sherpa hospitality.
Virtually no other international tourists - true cultural immersion without commercialization.

cost.title: What's Included & What's Excluded
cost_inclusions: Professional porters to carry 80% of luggage
TIMS Card and Sagarmatha National Park permit
All teahouse accommodations during trek (twin sharing rooms)
All meals during trek (breakfast, lunch, dinner)
Hotel accommodation in Kathmandu (2 nights - before/after trek)
Welcome and farewell dinner in Kathmandu
cost_exclusions: Personal expenses (phone calls, souvenirs, extra meals)
Hot showers and additional services at teahouses

cost_and_date_section.intro_text: Gokyo Lakes Trek is a premium Everest region experience for those seeking fewer crowds and pristine natural beauty. Departures available Spring (March-May) and Autumn (September-November). Early booking (8-10 weeks) recommended. Private departures can be arranged on your preferred dates.

date_highlights.highlight: Spring (March-May): Rhododendron blooms in lower valleys, clear skies
Autumn (Sept-Nov): Best visibility, stable weather, fewer crowds than EBC
Shortest Everest region trek - only 11 days vs 13+ for EBC
Perfect combination of high altitude and lower-impact experience

questions.question: How does Gokyo Lakes compare to Everest Base Camp?
questions.answer: Both reach similar altitudes (~5,300m). EBC trek is 13 days and very crowded. Gokyo is 11 days, less crowded, and features turquoise lakes instead of base camp. Gokyo Ri viewpoint (5,357m) rivals Kala Patthar (5,545m) for mountain views but with fewer trekkers.

questions.question: Is Gokyo easier than EBC?
questions.answer: Difficulty is similar - both reach 5,300m+. Gokyo is slightly easier (fewer steep sections, one day shorter) but still requires good fitness and acclimatization discipline. Altitude is the main challenge on both treks.

questions.question: Will I be alone in Gokyo?
questions.answer: You won't be completely alone, but Gokyo Valley has far fewer trekkers than the EBC route (80% fewer). Lodge capacity is lower, trail is quieter, and sense of wilderness is greater. Perfect for those seeking mountain experience with fewer crowds.

questions.question: What teahouse facilities are like in Gokyo?
questions.answer: Basic but comfortable - twin rooms, blankets, basic meals. Hot showers available (extra cost). WiFi minimal. No luxury amenities. This is authentic Himalayan lodging. Bring own entertainment. Embrace the simplicity!

questions.question: Is food safe in Gokyo Valley?
questions.answer: Yes, food is safe. Teahouses provide simple Sherpa food: dal bhat (rice + lentils), noodles, eggs, potatoes. Bring hand sanitizer. Water is boiled. Giardia risk is low if you follow basic hygiene. Acclimatization may suppress appetite anyway.

gallery_images.title: Turquoise Lakes
gallery_images.caption: Chain of five pristine glacial lakes in Gokyo Valley

gallery_images.title: Ngozumpa Glacier
gallery_images.caption: Nepal's largest glacier spanning the valley

additional_info_sections.heading: Perfect Trek For...
articles: Gokyo Lakes Trek is ideal for trekkers seeking a balance between achievement and authenticity. If you want to reach high altitude (5,300m+) while avoiding the crowds and commercialization of the main EBC route, this is your trek. If you value pristine natural beauty, turquoise lakes, and off-the-beaten-path Sherpa culture over a famous base camp visit, Gokyo offers a superior experience.
This trek rewards those willing to venture slightly off the main trail. You'll return home with stories of isolation, beauty, and personal discovery rather than crowded lodge encounters.

bullets.text: Good fitness required - 5-6 weeks training recommended
Shortest major Everest trek - only 11 days total
Significantly fewer crowds than EBC route
